alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 20 at 12:24PM EST until February 25 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County. For the Maple River...including Maple Rapids...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maple River at Maple Rapids. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of County Line Road and a home along County Line Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EST Sunday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM EST Sunday was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.3 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.3 feet on 11/02/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1230 AM EST.
